reviewText: Brilliant, wonderful and quite splendid. The 'Carry On' comedy film series (and this is only a small slice) is a part of British cinematic film history. If you are in need of anti-political-correctness medication, then self prescribe yourself a dose of these movies. This is proof why the British (and Irish) have the best sense of humor in the entire universe.
Only 5 of the films are anamorphic and the rest are 4x3 letterboxed. Major disappointment as the original Anchor Bay set was all 16x9. Picture quality is good otherwise.

This collection of movies would never have been made now.  It is hilariously sexist slapstick comedy at its best.
It is also quite satirical.  Who would have guessed that India had been conquered because a regiment of
Scottish soldiers did not wear underpants?
Haven't seen some of these movies more over 30 years. I loved their comedy then and still love it now

Another 8 movie set continuing what started in 2002 with The Carry On Collection, and then with Carry on Collection 1. The movies in this set are (with listed bonus features): CARRY ON HENRY VIII (1971) -Audio Commentary with Alan Hume -Trailer -Stills Gallery; -Carry On Trivia -On Location Report Documentary CARRY ON AT YOUR CONVENIENCE (1971) -Audio Commentary with Richard O'Callaghan & Jackie Piper -Trailer -Stills Gallery -Carry On Trivia CARRY ON MATRON (1972) -Audio Commentary with Valerie Leon & Jackie Piper -Trailer -Stills Gallery -Carry On Trivia CARRY ON ABROAD (1972) -Audio Commentary -Theatrical Trailer -Trivia -Photo Gallery CARRY ON GIRLS (1973) -Audio Commentary with Jack Douglas, June Whitfield & Patsy Rowlands -Trailer -On Location The Carry On's Feature -Stills Gallery -Carry On Trivia CARRY ON DICK (1974) -Audio Commentary with Jack Douglas -Theatrical Trailer -Trivia -Photo Gallery CARRY ON BEHIND (1976): -Audio Commentary With Patsy Rowlands, Jack Douglas, Dave Freeman & Larry Dann -Theatrical Trailer -Photo Gallery -Carry On Trivia CARRY ON ENGLAND (1976): -Audio Commentary With Patrick Mower -Theatrical Trailer -Photo Gallery -Carry On Trivia The only films left to get after these three sets are Carry On Emmannuelle (1978),Carry On Columbus, and then there are the TV shows (Carry On Laughing - The Complete Series and Carry on Christmas). Have fun and... carry on!

Kenneth Williams' antics are always a pleasure to watch, no matter how many times you may have seen a particular movie of his.  Although I had seen most of the "Carry On.." series years ago on the big screen, I felt I needed to have the collection on DVDs, just as I had them on VHS in the 1990's.
love these movies..great acting and humour. can't wait to buy #3..thankyou!!
Great memories from the 60s and 70s. Very enjoyable.

I purchased this for my husband, who by the way is from England, was very excited for the gift.  We started watching them and got through disk one with no problem but when we started disk 2 it would not play. The disk looks like there is a line right through it and not a scratch but a disk flaw that was there when the disk was made and not caught in quality control.
Some of the best of the British carry-on films. These are much funnier than the carry-on tv specials and tv series. They hold up as well or better than Monty Python.
I always enjoy the Carry On Movies.  Funny.
